parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To look around on, survey. From peri and blepo; to look all around.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
A circle, ring. As if dative case of kuklos; i.e. In a circle, i.e. all around.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
